page.title: 01Dunford Moors
page.content: This is an area of wild open moorland with only one habitation, Windleden Farm within it. Ruins of coaching inns can still be seen at Saltersbrook and Fiddlers Green. South of the river Etherow the land is peat, highly eroded in places with ling and bilberry dominant, giving way to mat grass on the lower slopes and cotton grass on the wetter, flatter areas. The land presents very poor grazing, but sheep are to be seen in summer even on the highest land within the block. The area is dotted with shooting butts, red grouse being the game. North of the river the land is similar but with abandoned fields in the valleys. The whole of the area lies withn the Peak District National Park but at present only half is open to the public.
